title: Can we consider the petroglyphs as art? Why or why not? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m not sure that the label “Art” has any distinctive, reliable, or useful meaning anymore but, by just about any qualification, petroglyphs, should be considered as “Art” of a fairly high order. Most petroglyphs that survive today seem to be abstractions of animals, people, or graphical relationships. As with “modern” art they seem to have been created with a purpose beyond simple “realism” and exist because they were designed and created to communicate a message or decorative motif that reflects complex thought and awareness of value beyond mechanical communication of facts or quantities.
